content: I run a POP3 account but I was under the impression that, unless the folders trying to be created with in the Local Folders, they are best created in the online account of your Email provider - which then mirrors them on the IMAP TB section. Have you tried this?
creator: frisée

content: I don't know what the 'Mail Channels Quarantine Digest' is. Please give me some additional information as I can't find that in Thunderbird and a search for it on Mozilla comes up with zero results.

content: This Forum post addresses your question - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1477502 You can search for previous questions and answers using the Search window at the top right of any Forum page.

content: This issue may have come about with the latest esr update. If that's an early release channel, how can I switch back to the normal release channel and thus resolve this issue? Screenshot attached.
creator: trumpman

content:
128.6.1esr is the current version and not a 'beta'. Uninstalling and reinstalling would be an option but you need to safeguard all your profile files before continuing. That wouldn't be guaranteed to resolve the issue, though.

Does right-clicking on the link and choosing the relevant command work?
creator: frisée

content: Please send a screenshot of the problem you are experiencing.
creator: frisée

content: Ideas and suggestions can be loaded here - https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas As an aside, recovering an error is built into the Windows OS and is accessed by using the keyboard command Ctrl+Z
creator: frisée

content: You can make Local Folders in Thunderbird and copy the messages that you want to save into those folders for safe keeping. I don't know what you mean by 'Thunderbird server' - TB is not an Email provider and does not have a server. It is also good housekeeping to back up your Profile at least once a week to safeguard against data loss.
creator: frisée

content:
Please explain a bit further as to what you mean by 'removing a lost password'. It seems from your post that you are referring to an email on an Email account but I don't know why that would need to be 'removed'.

Please also include a screenshot of any errors that you have received to help us understand the problem.

There is only one question that you have submitted here so no one has suggested any action for you to take.
creator: frisée

content: Is this the method you are using? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-import
creator: frisée

content: Threads is a toggle that can be switched off using the toggle icon
creator: frisée

content: Ahh… I was wondering why I was seeing so many questions lately asking how to remove threading, because I'm used to change that setting using the View options, but now I'm starting to think what's happening is that many users click that icon, not knowing what it does, and see the effect later when they no longer associate the threading with having clicked that icon…
creator: DavidGG

content:
The IMAP password is something you set with your Email Provider. If you have forgotten it, you would need to ask for a password reset.

However, is there an error message that Thunderbird is producing? Please provide a screenshot if there is.

.oOo.

Le mot de passe IMAP est défini par votre fournisseur de messagerie. Si vous l'avez oublié, vous devrez demander une réinitialisation du mot de passe.

Cependant, Thunderbird génère-t-il un message d'erreur ? Veuillez fournir une capture d'écran si c'est le cas.
creator: frisée

content: You mean the Trash? Click inside the list of emails. Select Ctrl+A so it all goes blue. Hit 'Delete' on the keyboard. Or right-click on the Trash Folder and select 'Empty Trash'.
creator: frisée

content:
This article explains about the recovery of missing files and folders after an upgrade: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/recover-user-data-missing-after-thunderbird-update

If you are experiencing a different problem please give additional infomation.
creator: frisée
